subject: ARORP (Arkansas Opioid Recovery Partnership)
source_summary: Primary sources from ARORP's official website (About, Funding Guidelines, News, Reports), ARORP-hosted governing PDFs (Arkansas Opioids MOU, QSF court order, Distribution Agreements), Association of Arkansas Counties (AAC) reporting on ARORP operations and distributions, and federal legal authorities (U.S. Code for DFC; IRC/CFR for QSF). Supplemental context from ACHI and OpioidSettlementGuides.

authority_reference.citation: Arkansas Opioids Memorandum of Understanding (Executed July 2021) (PDF hosted by ARORP): https://www.arorp.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Arkansas-Opioids-MOU-Executed-July-2021.pdf
authority_reference.administering_body: State of Arkansas, Arkansas counties, and Arkansas cities/towns (MOU signatories)

authority_reference.citation: Order Establishing the Arkansas Opioids Qualified Settlement Fund, Appointing the Fund Administrator, and Appointing the Custodial Bank (Crittenden County Circuit Court, Case No. 18CV-22-355, filed June 13 2022) (PDF hosted by ARORP): https://www.arorp.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/2022-06-13-Order-Establishing-QSF.pdf
26 U.S.C. § 468B (Special rules for designated settlement funds) (Cornell LII): https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/26/468B
Counties Distribution Agreement (PDF hosted by ARORP): https://www.arorp.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Counties-Distribution-Agreement-without-exhibits.pdf
Cities Distribution Agreement (PDF hosted by ARORP): https://www.arorp.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Cities-Distribution-Agreement-without-exhibits.pdf
authority_reference.administering_body: Arkansas cities and towns (party to agreement)

authority_reference.citation: 21 U.S.C. Chapter 20, Subchapter II, Part A (Drug-Free Communities Support Program) (U.S. Code House): https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?edition=prelim&path=%2Fprelim%40title21%2Fchapter20%2Fsubchapter2%2FpartA
authority_reference.administering_body: Office of National Drug Control Policy (ONDCP) and Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) (as referenced in U.S. Code definitions)

money_flow.source: Opioid settlement payments allocated to Arkansas (multiple settlements/bankruptcies referenced by Arkansas Opioids MOU)
money_flow.destination: State of Arkansas; Arkansas counties; Arkansas cities/towns (each one-third allocation)

money_flow.source: Settling Pharmaceutical Supply Chain Participants (as referenced in QSF court order)

money_flow.destination: Arkansas counties (as defined/covered by Arkansas Opioids MOU and Counties Distribution Agreement)
Arkansas cities and towns (as defined/covered by Arkansas Opioids MOU and Cities Distribution Agreement)

money_flow.source: Arkansas Opioid Recovery Partnership (ARORP) (operational disbursement program referenced by AAC)
money_flow.destination: Arkansas counties (all 75 counties referenced by AAC)
13 COPE coalitions (Coalition Partnership Empowerment project participants)

money_flow.source: Office of National Drug Control Policy (ONDCP) (Drug-Free Communities Support Program)
money_flow.destination: Seven Arkansas COPE coalitions (listed in ARORP news release)

money_flow.source: Arkansas Opioid Recovery Partnership (ARORP) (Arkansas Naloxone Bank credit/disbursement model described by AAC)
money_flow.destination: Community organizations and law enforcement (Naloxone Community Hero projects referenced by AAC)

evidence_item.claim_summary: ARORP describes itself as the Arkansas Opioid Recovery Partnership and states it was created in 2022 by the Arkansas Municipal League and the Association of Arkansas Counties.
ARORP publishes Annual Reports and Quarterly Reports via its official Reports page.
ARORP published an annual evaluation report for calendar year 2024 describing program categories and evaluation components (process, transparency, outcomes).

source.title: ARORP Annual Evaluation Report for 2024 (PDF)
source.issuing_body: Arkansas Opioid Recovery Partnership (ARORP) (report hosted on ARORP site)

evidence_item.claim_summary: AAC states ARORP has operated since November 2022 (formed by AML and AAC) and reports ARORP distributed more than $26.3 million to all 75 counties; reports naloxone disbursements and a WYSAC funding amount of $398087 for a data system and evaluation work.

source.title: Updates on ARORP opioid settlement funds

evidence_item.claim_summary: Executed Arkansas Opioids Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) document governing allocation and use framework for opioid settlement and bankruptcy funds in Arkansas.

source.title: Arkansas Opioids MOU (Executed July 2021) (PDF)
source.issuing_body: MOU signatories (State of Arkansas; Arkansas counties; Arkansas cities/towns)

evidence_item.claim_summary: Court order establishes Arkansas Opioids Qualified Settlement Fund, appoints Fund Administrator and Custodial Bank, and references governing MOU and tax treatment under IRC 468B and Treas. Reg. 1.468B-1.

source.title: Order Establishing the Arkansas Opioids Qualified Settlement Fund (PDF)

evidence_item.claim_summary: Counties Distribution Agreement references the Arkansas Opioids MOU and one-third allocation rule and describes distribution mechanics for county shares (exhibits omitted in hosted version).
Cities Distribution Agreement references the Arkansas Opioids MOU and one-third allocation rule and describes distribution mechanics for city/town shares (exhibits omitted in hosted version).

source.title: Cities Distribution Agreement (PDF, without exhibits)
source.issuing_body: Arkansas cities and towns (party to agreement)

evidence_item.claim_summary: ARORP publishes funding guidelines requiring letters of support for proposals not submitted by the Partnership Director and stating that noncompliance may result in funding termination.

ARORP reports an initial $536607 investment supporting 13 COPE coalitions for training to prepare Drug-Free Communities grant applications; reports that seven coalitions received DFC grants at $125000 per year for five years ($625000 each).

source.title: Arkansas coalitions receive nearly $4.4 million for substance use prevention

evidence_item.claim_summary: U.S. Code House provides text for 21 U.S.C. Chapter 20 Subchapter II Part A describing the Drug-Free Communities Support Program framework and definitions referencing ONDCP and SAMHSA roles.

source.title: U.S. Code: Part A—Drug-Free Communities Support Program
source.issuing_body: Office of the Law Revision Counsel (U.S. House of Representatives) (U.S. Code publication)

evidence_item.claim_summary: Federal statute text for 26 U.S.C. 468B governing designated settlement funds, referenced by Arkansas QSF order.

source.title: 26 U.S.C. § 468B
source.issuing_body: United States (U.S. Code as published via Cornell LII)

evidence_item.claim_summary: Federal regulation text for 26 CFR 1.468B-1 defining Qualified Settlement Funds, referenced by Arkansas QSF order.

source.title: 26 CFR § 1.468B-1
source.issuing_body: United States (CFR as published via Cornell LII)

evidence_item.claim_summary: ACHI policy brief discusses Arkansas opioid settlement expectations (including an approximate $216 million figure and payment horizon beginning late 2022 or 2023) and notes the MOU allocation framework.

source.title: Principles to Guide Spending of Opioid Settlement Funds (PDF)

evidence_item.claim_summary: OpioidSettlementGuides community guide page reports a rounded total funds figure for Arkansas opioid settlements ($227.70 million) and provides a transparency-oriented overview (secondary source).

extraction_notes: Known gaps from the provided sources: (1) exact ledger-grade totals for settlement inflows to Arkansas and exact amounts distributed by ARORP beyond narrative phrasing (e.g., 'more than $26.3 million') require either an ARORP transparency report/ledger export or QSF disbursement statements; (2) recipient-level award tables for ARORP-funded projects were not extracted here because the specific project list/table pages were not captured in the provided research excerpt; (3) denial lists, denial counts, appeal mechanisms, and audit findings were not evidenced in the captured sources; ARORP navigation indicates 'Denial Reports' and 'Transparency Reports' sections exist, but individual denial/audit documents were not included in the excerpted set; (4) naloxone disbursement totals in AAC reporting include cents and were preserved in evidence but the money_flow amount is set to 0 to avoid rounding/truncation.
